auth.description: API token, basic auth in the `username:password` format or `anonymous` (string literal). May alternatively be set via the `GRAFANA_AUTH` environment variable.

ca_cert.description: Certificate CA bundle (file path or literal value) to use to verify the Grafana server's certificate. May alternatively be set via the `GRAFANA_CA_CERT` environment variable.

cloud_access_policy_token.description: Access Policy Token for Grafana Cloud. May alternatively be set via the `GRAFANA_CLOUD_ACCESS_POLICY_TOKEN` environment variable.

cloud_api_url.description: Grafana Cloud's API URL. May alternatively be set via the `GRAFANA_CLOUD_API_URL` environment variable.

http_headers.description: Optional. HTTP headers mapping keys to values used for accessing the Grafana and Grafana Cloud APIs. May alternatively be set via the `GRAFANA_HTTP_HEADERS` environment variable in JSON format.

insecure_skip_verify.description: Skip TLS certificate verification. May alternatively be set via the `GRAFANA_INSECURE_SKIP_VERIFY` environment variable.

oncall_access_token.description: A Grafana OnCall access token. May alternatively be set via the `GRAFANA_ONCALL_ACCESS_TOKEN` environment variable.

oncall_url.description: An Grafana OnCall backend address. May alternatively be set via the `GRAFANA_ONCALL_URL` environment variable.

org_id.description: Deprecated: Use the `org_id` attributes on resources instead.

retries.description: The amount of retries to use for Grafana API and Grafana Cloud API calls. May alternatively be set via the `GRAFANA_RETRIES` environment variable.

retry_status_codes.description: The status codes to retry on for Grafana API and Grafana Cloud API calls. Use `x` as a digit wildcard. Defaults to 429 and 5xx. May alternatively be set via the `GRAFANA_RETRY_STATUS_CODES` environment variable.

retry_wait.description: The amount of time in seconds to wait between retries for Grafana API and Grafana Cloud API calls. May alternatively be set via the `GRAFANA_RETRY_WAIT` environment variable.

sm_access_token.description: A Synthetic Monitoring access token. May alternatively be set via the `GRAFANA_SM_ACCESS_TOKEN` environment variable.

sm_url.description: Synthetic monitoring backend address. May alternatively be set via the `GRAFANA_SM_URL` environment variable. The correct value for each service region is cited in the [Synthetic Monitoring documentation](https://grafana.com/docs/grafana-cloud/monitor-public-endpoints/private-probes/#probe-api-server-url). Note the `sm_url` value is optional, but it must correspond with the value specified as the `region_slug` in the `grafana_cloud_stack` resource. Also note that when a Terraform configuration contains multiple provider instances managing SM resources associated with the same Grafana stack, specifying an explicit `sm_url` set to the same value for each provider ensures all providers interact with the same SM API.

store_dashboard_sha256.description: Set to true if you want to save only the sha256sum instead of complete dashboard model JSON in the tfstate.

tls_cert.description: Client TLS certificate (file path or literal value) to use to authenticate to the Grafana server. May alternatively be set via the `GRAFANA_TLS_CERT` environment variable.

tls_key.description: Client TLS key (file path or literal value) to use to authenticate to the Grafana server. May alternatively be set via the `GRAFANA_TLS_KEY` environment variable.

url.description: The root URL of a Grafana server. May alternatively be set via the `GRAFANA_URL` environment variable.

dashboard_id.description: The ID of the dashboard on which to create the annotation. Deprecated: Use dashboard_uid instead.

dashboard_uid.description: The ID of the dashboard on which to create the annotation.

org_id.description: The Organization ID. If not set, the Org ID defined in the provider block will be used.

panel_id.description: The ID of the dashboard panel on which to create the annotation.

tags.description: The tags to associate with the annotation.

text.description: The text to associate with the annotation.

time.description: The RFC 3339-formatted time string indicating the annotation's time.

time_end.description: The RFC 3339-formatted time string indicating the annotation's end time.

block.description:
Manages Grafana API Keys.

* [HTTP API](https://grafana.com/docs/grafana/latest/developers/http_api/auth/)

!> Deprecated: please use `grafana_service_account` and `grafana_service_account_token` instead, see [Migrate API keys to Grafana service accounts using Terraform](https://grafana.com/docs/grafana/latest/administration/api-keys/#migrate-api-keys-to-grafana-service-accounts-using-terraform) for more information.

created_at.description: Creation date of the access policy.

display_name.description: Display name of the access policy. Defaults to the name.

name.description: Name of the access policy.

region.description: Region where the API is deployed. Generally where the stack is deployed. Use the region list API to get the list of available regions: https://grafana.com/docs/grafana-cloud/developer-resources/api-reference/cloud-api/#list-regions.

scopes.description: Scopes of the access policy. See https://grafana.com/docs/grafana-cloud/account-management/authentication-and-permissions/access-policies/#scopes for possible values.

updated_at.description: Last update date of the access policy.

identifier.description: The identifier of the org or stack. For orgs, this is the slug, for stacks, this is the stack ID.

type.description: Whether a policy applies to a Cloud org or a specific stack. Should be one of `org` or `stack`.

selector.description: The label selector to match in metrics or logs query. Should be in PromQL or LogQL format.

block.description:
* [Official documentation](https://grafana.com/docs/grafana-cloud/account-management/authentication-and-permissions/access-policies/)
* [API documentation](https://grafana.com/docs/grafana-cloud/developer-resources/api-reference/cloud-api/#create-an-access-policy)

Required access policy scopes:

* accesspolicies:read
* accesspolicies:write
* accesspolicies:delete

access_policy_id.description: ID of the access policy for which to create a token.

display_name.description: Display name of the access policy token. Defaults to the name.

expires_at.description: Expiration date of the access policy token. Does not expire by default.

name.description: Name of the access policy token.

region.description: Region of the access policy. Should be set to the same region as the access policy. Use the region list API to get the list of available regions: https://grafana.com/docs/grafana-cloud/developer-resources/api-reference/cloud-api/#list-regions.

updated_at.description: Last update date of the access policy token.

role.description: Role of the API key. Should be one of [Viewer Editor Admin MetricsPublisher PluginPublisher]. See https://grafana.com/docs/grafana-cloud/api/#create-api-key for details.

alertmanager_name.description: Name of the Alertmanager instance configured for this stack.

alertmanager_user_id.description: User ID of the Alertmanager instance configured for this stack.

id.description: The stack id assigned to this stack by Grafana.

labels.description: A map of labels to assign to the stack. Label keys and values must match the following regexp: "^[a-zA-Z0-9/\\-.]+$" and stacks cannot have more than 10 labels.

name.description: Name of stack. Conventionally matches the url of the instance (e.g. `<stack_slug>.grafana.net`).

prometheus_remote_endpoint.description: Use this URL to query hosted metrics data e.g. Prometheus data source in Grafana

prometheus_remote_write_endpoint.description: Use this URL to send prometheus metrics to Grafana cloud

prometheus_user_id.description: Prometheus user ID. Used for e.g. remote_write.

region_slug.description: Region slug to assign to this stack. Changing region will destroy the existing stack and create a new one in the desired region. Use the region list API to get the list of available regions: https://grafana.com/docs/grafana-cloud/developer-resources/api-reference/cloud-api/#list-regions.

slug.description: Subdomain that the Grafana instance will be available at. Setting slug to `<stack_slug>` will make the instance available at `https://<stack_slug>.grafana.net`.

wait_for_readiness.description: Whether to wait for readiness of the stack after creating it. The check is a HEAD request to the stack URL (Grafana instance). Defaults to `true`.

wait_for_readiness_timeout.description: How long to wait for readiness (if enabled). Defaults to `5m0s`.

block.description:

This can be used to bootstrap a management service account for a new stack

* [Official documentation](https://grafana.com/docs/grafana/latest/administration/service-accounts/)
* [HTTP API](https://grafana.com/docs/grafana/latest/developers/http_api/serviceaccount/#service-account-api)

Required access policy scopes:

* stacks:read
* stack-service-accounts:write

Manages service account tokens of a Grafana Cloud stack using the Cloud API
This can be used to bootstrap a management service account token for a new stack

* [Official documentation](https://grafana.com/docs/grafana/latest/administration/service-accounts/)
* [HTTP API](https://grafana.com/docs/grafana/latest/developers/http_api/serviceaccount/#service-account-api)

Required access policy scopes:

* stack-service-accounts:write

An outlier detector monitors the results of a query and reports when its values are outside normal bands.

The normal band is configured by choice of algorithm, its sensitivity and other configuration.

Visit https://grafana.com/docs/grafana-cloud/machine-learning/outlier-detection/ for more details.

shifts.description: The list of ID's of on-call shifts.

admin_user.description:
The login name of the configured default admin user for the Grafana
installation. If unset, this value defaults to admin, the Grafana default.
Grafana adds the default admin user to all organizations automatically upon
creation, and this parameter keeps Terraform from removing it from
organizations.
 Defaults to `admin`.

admins.description:
A list of email addresses corresponding to users who should be given admin
access to the organization. Note: users specified here must already exist in
Grafana unless 'create_users' is set to true.

create_users.description:
Whether or not to create Grafana users specified in the organization's
membership if they don't already exist in Grafana. If unspecified, this
parameter defaults to true, creating placeholder users with the name, login,
and email set to the email of the user, and a random password. Setting this
option to false will cause an error to be thrown for any users that do not
already exist in Grafana.
 Defaults to `true`.

editors.description:
A list of email addresses corresponding to users who should be given editor
access to the organization. Note: users specified here must already exist in
Grafana unless 'create_users' is set to true.

name.description: The display name for the Grafana organization created.

org_id.description: The organization id assigned to this organization by Grafana.

users_without_access.description:
A list of email addresses corresponding to users who should be given none access to the organization.
Note: users specified here must already exist in Grafana, unless 'create_users' is
set to true. This feature is only available in Grafana 10.2+.

viewers.description:
A list of email addresses corresponding to users who should be given viewer
access to the organization. Note: users specified here must already exist in
Grafana unless 'create_users' is set to true.

week_start.description: The Organization week start day. Available values are `sunday`, `monday`, `saturday`, or an empty string for the default. Defaults to ``.

dashboard_id.description: Dashboard to be sent in the report. This field is deprecated, use `dashboard_uid` instead.

formats.description: Specifies what kind of attachment to generate for the report. Allowed values: `pdf`, `csv`, `image`.

include_dashboard_link.description: Whether to include a link to the dashboard in the report. Defaults to `true`.

include_table_csv.description: Whether to include a CSV file of table panel data. Defaults to `false`.

layout.description: Layout of the report. Allowed values: `simple`, `grid`. Defaults to `grid`.

message.description: Message to be sent in the report.

name.description: Name of the report.

orientation.description: Orientation of the report. Allowed values: `landscape`, `portrait`. Defaults to `landscape`.

recipients.description: List of recipients of the report.

reply_to.description: Reply-to email address of the report.

report_variables.description: Add report variables to the dashboard. Values should be separated by commas.

uid.description: Dashboard uid.

block.description: Time range of the report.

custom_interval.description:
Custom interval of the report.
**Note:** This field is only available when frequency is set to `custom`.

end_time.description: End time of the report. If empty, the report will be sent indefinitely (according to frequency). Note that times will be saved as UTC in Grafana. Use 2006-01-02T15:04:05 format if you want to set a custom timezone

frequency.description: Frequency of the report. Allowed values: `never`, `once`, `hourly`, `daily`, `weekly`, `monthly`, `custom`.

last_day_of_month.description: Send the report on the last day of the month Defaults to `false`.

start_time.description: Start time of the report. If empty, the start date will be set to the creation time. Note that times will be saved as UTC in Grafana. Use 2006-01-02T15:04:05 format if you want to set a custom timezone

timezone.description: Set the report time zone. Defaults to `GMT`.

workdays_only.description: Whether to send the report only on work days. Defaults to `false`.

auto_increment_version.description: Whether the role version should be incremented automatically on updates (and set to 1 on creation). This field or `version` should be set.

display_name.description: Display name of the role. Available with Grafana 8.5+.

global.description: Boolean to state whether the role is available across all organizations or not. Defaults to `false`.

group.description: Group of the role. Available with Grafana 8.5+.

hidden.description: Boolean to state whether the role should be visible in the Grafana UI or not. Available with Grafana 8.5+. Defaults to `false`.

name.description: Name of the role

version.description: Version of the role. A role is updated only on version increase. This field or `auto_increment_version` should be set.

action.description: Specific action users granted with the role will be allowed to perform (for example: `users:read`)

scope.description: Scope to restrict the action to a set of resources (for example: `users:*` or `roles:customrole1`) Defaults to ``.

block.description: Specific set of actions granted by the role.

disable_provenance.description: Allow modifying the rule group from other sources than Terraform or the Grafana API. Defaults to `false`.

folder_uid.description: The UID of the folder that the group belongs to.

interval_seconds.description: The interval, in seconds, at which all rules in the group are evaluated. If a group contains many rules, the rules are evaluated sequentially.

name.description: The name of the rule group.

org_id.description: The Organization ID. If not set, the Org ID defined in the provider block will be used.

annotations.description: Key-value pairs of metadata to attach to the alert rule that may add user-defined context, but cannot be used for matching, grouping, or routing. Defaults to `map[]`.

condition.description: The `ref_id` of the query node in the `data` field to use as the alert condition.

exec_err_state.description: Describes what state to enter when the rule's query is invalid and the rule cannot be executed. Options are OK, Error, and Alerting. Defaults to `Alerting`.

for.description: The amount of time for which the rule must be breached for the rule to be considered to be Firing. Before this time has elapsed, the rule is only considered to be Pending. Defaults to `0`.

is_paused.description: Sets whether the alert should be paused or not. Defaults to `false`.

labels.description: Key-value pairs to attach to the alert rule that can be used in matching, grouping, and routing. Defaults to `map[]`.

name.description: The name of the alert rule.

no_data_state.description: Describes what state to enter when the rule's query returns No Data. Options are OK, NoData, and Alerting. Defaults to `NoData`.

uid.description: The unique identifier of the alert rule.

datasource_uid.description: The UID of the datasource being queried, or "-100" if this stage is an expression stage.

model.description: Custom JSON data to send to the specified datasource when querying.

query_type.description: An optional identifier for the type of query being executed. Defaults to ``.

ref_id.description: A unique string to identify this query stage within a rule.

from.description: The number of seconds in the past, relative to when the rule is evaluated, at which the time range begins.

to.description: The number of seconds in the past, relative to when the rule is evaluated, at which the time range ends.

block.description: The time range, relative to when the query is executed, across which to query.
A sequence of stages that describe the contents of the rule.

contact_point.description: The contact point to route notifications that match this rule to.

group_by.description: A list of alert labels to group alerts into notifications by. Use the special label `...` to group alerts by all labels, effectively disabling grouping. If empty, no grouping is used. If specified, requires labels 'alertname' and 'grafana_folder' to be included.

group_interval.description: Minimum time interval between two notifications for the same group. Default is 5 minutes.

group_wait.description: Time to wait to buffer alerts of the same group before sending a notification. Default is 30 seconds.

mute_timings.description: A list of mute timing names to apply to alerts that match this policy.

repeat_interval.description: Minimum time interval for re-sending a notification if an alert is still firing. Default is 4 hours.

block.description: Notification settings for the rule. If specified, it overrides the notification policies. Available since Grafana 10.4, requires feature flag 'alertingSimplifiedRouting' enabled.
The rules within the group.

has_expired.description: The status of the service account token.

key.description: The key of the service account token.

name.description: The name of the service account token.

seconds_to_live.description: The key expiration in seconds. It is optional. If it is a positive number an expiration date for the key is set. If it is null, zero or is omitted completely (unless `api_key_max_seconds_to_live` configuration option is set) the key will never expire.

description.description: Description is a free-text field that can provide more context to an SLO.

name.description: Name should be a short description of your indicator. Consider names like "API Availability"

block.description: Annotations will be attached to all alerts generated by any of these rules.
Annotations to attach only to Fast Burn alerts.
Labels to attach only to Fast Burn alerts.
Alerting Rules generated for Fast Burn alerts
Labels will be attached to all alerts generated by any of these rules.
Annotations to attach only to Slow Burn alerts.
Labels to attach only to Slow Burn alerts.
Alerting Rules generated for Slow Burn alerts

Configures the alerting rules that will be generated for each
				time window associated with the SLO. Grafana SLOs can generate
				alerts when the short-term error budget burn is very high, the
				long-term error budget burn rate is high, or when the remaining
				error budget is below a certain threshold. Annotations and Labels support templating.

uid.description: UID for the Mimir Datasource

block.description: Destination Datasource sets the datasource defined for an SLO

Additional labels that will be attached to all metrics generated from the query. These labels are useful for grouping SLOs in dashboard views that you create by hand. Labels must adhere to Prometheus label name schema - "^[a-zA-Z_][a-zA-Z0-9_]*$"

value.description: Value between 0 and 1. If the value of the query is above the objective, the SLO is met.

window.description: A Prometheus-parsable time duration string like 24h, 60m. This is the time window the objective is measured over.

block.description: Over each rolling time window, the remaining error budget will be calculated, and separate alerts can be generated for each time window based on the SLO burn rate or remaining error budget.

type.description: Query type must be one of: "freeform", "query", "ratio", or "threshold"

group_by_labels.description: Defines Group By Labels used for per-label alerting. These appear as variables on SLO dashboards to enable filtering and aggregation. Labels must adhere to Prometheus label name schema - "^[a-zA-Z_][a-zA-Z0-9_]*$"

block.description: Query describes the indicator that will be measured against the objective. Freeform Query types are currently supported.

Resource manages Grafana SLOs. 

* [Official documentation](https://grafana.com/docs/grafana-cloud/alerting-and-irm/slo/)
* [API documentation](https://grafana.com/docs/grafana-cloud/alerting-and-irm/slo/api/)
* [Additional Information On Alerting Rule Annotations and Labels](https://prometheus.io/docs/prometheus/latest/configuration/alerting_rules/#templating/)

provider_name.description: The name of the SSO provider. Supported values: github, gitlab, google, azuread, okta, generic_oauth.

allow_assign_grafana_admin.description: If enabled, it will automatically sync the Grafana server administrator role.

allow_sign_up.description: If not enabled, only existing Grafana users can log in using OAuth.

allowed_domains.description: List of comma- or space-separated domains. The user should belong to at least one domain to log in.

allowed_groups.description: List of comma- or space-separated groups. The user should be a member of at least one group to log in. For Generic OAuth, if you configure allowed_groups, you must also configure groups_attribute_path.

allowed_organizations.description: List of comma- or space-separated organizations. The user should be a member of at least one organization to log in.

api_url.description: The user information endpoint of your OAuth2 provider. Required for azuread, okta and generic_oauth providers.

auth_style.description: It determines how client_id and client_secret are sent to Oauth2 provider. Possible values are AutoDetect, InParams, InHeader. Default is AutoDetect.

auth_url.description: The authorization endpoint of your OAuth2 provider. Required for azuread, okta and generic_oauth providers.

auto_login.description: Log in automatically, skipping the login screen.

client_id.description: The client Id of your OAuth2 app.

client_secret.description: The client secret of your OAuth2 app.

custom.description: Custom fields to configure for OAuth2 such as the [force_use_graph_api](https://grafana.com/docs/grafana/latest/setup-grafana/configure-security/configure-authentication/azuread/#force-fetching-groups-from-microsoft-graph-api) field.

email_attribute_name.description: Name of the key to use for user email lookup within the attributes map of OAuth2 ID token. Only applicable to Generic OAuth.

email_attribute_path.description: JMESPath expression to use for user email lookup from the user information. Only applicable to Generic OAuth.

empty_scopes.description: If enabled, no scopes will be sent to the OAuth2 provider.

enabled.description: Define whether this configuration is enabled for the specified provider. Defaults to `true`.

groups_attribute_path.description: JMESPath expression to use for user group lookup. If you configure allowed_groups, you must also configure groups_attribute_path.

id_token_attribute_name.description: The name of the key used to extract the ID token from the returned OAuth2 token. Only applicable to Generic OAuth.

login_attribute_path.description: JMESPath expression to use for user login lookup from the user ID token. Only applicable to Generic OAuth.

name.description: Helpful if you use more than one identity providers or SSO protocols.

name_attribute_path.description: JMESPath expression to use for user name lookup from the user ID token. This name will be used as the users display name. Only applicable to Generic OAuth.

role_attribute_path.description: JMESPath expression to use for Grafana role lookup.

role_attribute_strict.description: If enabled, denies user login if the Grafana role cannot be extracted using Role attribute path.

scopes.description: List of comma- or space-separated OAuth2 scopes.

signout_redirect_url.description: The URL to redirect the user to after signing out from Grafana.

skip_org_role_sync.description: Prevent synchronizing users organization roles from your IdP.

team_ids.description: String list of Team Ids. If set, the user must be a member of one of the given teams to log in. If you configure team_ids, you must also configure teams_url and team_ids_attribute_path.

team_ids_attribute_path.description: The JMESPath expression to use for Grafana Team Id lookup within the results returned by the teams_url endpoint. Only applicable to Generic OAuth.

teams_url.description: The URL used to query for Team Ids. If not set, the default value is /teams. If you configure teams_url, you must also configure team_ids_attribute_path. Only applicable to Generic OAuth.

tls_client_ca.description: The path to the trusted certificate authority list. Is not applicable on Grafana Cloud.

tls_client_cert.description: The path to the certificate. Is not applicable on Grafana Cloud.

tls_client_key.description: The path to the key. Is not applicable on Grafana Cloud.

tls_skip_verify_insecure.description: If enabled, the client accepts any certificate presented by the server and any host name in that certificate. You should only use this for testing, because this mode leaves SSL/TLS susceptible to man-in-the-middle attacks.

token_url.description: The token endpoint of your OAuth2 provider. Required for azuread, okta and generic_oauth providers.

use_pkce.description: If enabled, Grafana will use Proof Key for Code Exchange (PKCE) with the OAuth2 Authorization Code Grant.

use_refresh_token.description: If enabled, Grafana will fetch a new access token using the refresh token provided by the OAuth2 provider.

block.description: The SSO settings set.

Manages Grafana SSO Settings for OAuth2. SAML support will be added soon.

* [Official documentation](https://grafana.com/docs/grafana/latest/setup-grafana/configure-security/configure-authentication/)
* [HTTP API](https://grafana.com/docs/grafana/latest/developers/http_api/sso-settings/)

alert_sensitivity.description: Can be set to `none`, `low`, `medium`, or `high` to correspond to the check [alert levels](https://grafana.com/docs/grafana-cloud/monitor-public-endpoints/synthetic-monitoring-alerting/). Defaults to `none`.

basic_metrics_only.description: Metrics are reduced by default. Set this to `false` if you'd like to publish all metrics. We maintain a [full list of metrics](https://github.com/grafana/synthetic-monitoring-agent/tree/main/internal/scraper/testdata) collected for each. Defaults to `true`.

enabled.description: Whether to enable the check. Defaults to `true`.

frequency.description: How often the check runs in milliseconds (the value is not truly a "frequency" but a "period"). The minimum acceptable value is 1 second (1000 ms), and the maximum is 120 seconds (120000 ms). Defaults to `60000`.

labels.description: Custom labels to be included with collected metrics and logs. The maximum number of labels that can be specified per check is 5. These are applied, along with the probe-specific labels, to the outgoing metrics. The names and values of the labels cannot be empty, and the maximum length is 32 bytes.

probes.description: List of probe location IDs where this target will be checked from.

tenant_id.description: The tenant ID of the check.

timeout.description: Specifies the maximum running time for the check in milliseconds. The minimum acceptable value is 1 second (1000 ms), and the maximum 10 seconds (10000 ms). Defaults to `3000`.

ip_version.description: Options are `V4`, `V6`, `Any`. Specifies whether the corresponding check will be performed using IPv4 or IPv6. The `Any` value indicates that IPv6 should be used, falling back to IPv4 if that's not available. Defaults to `V4`.

server.description: DNS server address to target. Defaults to `8.8.8.8`.

valid_r_codes.description: List of valid response codes. Options include `NOERROR`, `BADALG`, `BADMODE`, `BADKEY`, `BADCOOKIE`, `BADNAME`, `BADSIG`, `BADTIME`, `BADTRUNC`, `BADVERS`, `FORMERR`, `NOTIMP`, `NOTAUTH`, `NOTZONE`, `NXDOMAIN`, `NXRRSET`, `REFUSED`, `SERVFAIL`, `YXDOMAIN`, `YXRRSET`.

fail_if_not_matches_regexp.description: Fail if value does not match regex.

block.description: Validate additional matches.

fail_if_not_matches_regexp.description: Fail if value does not match regex.

block.description: Validate response answer.

fail_if_not_matches_regexp.description: Fail if value does not match regex.

block.description: Validate response authority.
Settings for DNS check. The target must be a valid hostname (or IP address for `PTR` records).

bearer_token.description: Token for use with bearer authorization header.

body.description: The body of the HTTP request used in probe.

cache_busting_query_param_name.description: The name of the query parameter used to prevent the server from using a cached response. Each probe will assign a random value to this parameter each time a request is made.

fail_if_body_matches_regexp.description: List of regexes. If any match the response body, the check will fail.

fail_if_body_not_matches_regexp.description: List of regexes. If any do not match the response body, the check will fail.

fail_if_not_ssl.description: Fail if SSL is not present. Defaults to `false`.

fail_if_ssl.description: Fail if SSL is present. Defaults to `false`.

headers.description: The HTTP headers set for the probe.

ip_version.description: Options are `V4`, `V6`, `Any`. Specifies whether the corresponding check will be performed using IPv4 or IPv6. The `Any` value indicates that IPv6 should be used, falling back to IPv4 if that's not available. Defaults to `V4`.

method.description: Request method. One of `GET`, `CONNECT`, `DELETE`, `HEAD`, `OPTIONS`, `POST`, `PUT`, `TRACE` Defaults to `GET`.

no_follow_redirects.description: Do not follow redirects. Defaults to `false`.

proxy_connect_headers.description: The HTTP headers sent to the proxy URL

valid_http_versions.description: List of valid HTTP versions. Options include `HTTP/1.0`, `HTTP/1.1`, `HTTP/2.0`

valid_status_codes.description: Accepted status codes. If unset, defaults to 2xx.

block.description: Basic auth settings.

allow_missing.description: Allow header to be missing from responses. Defaults to `false`.

regexp.description: Regex that header value should match.

block.description: Check fails if headers match.

allow_missing.description: Allow header to be missing from responses. Defaults to `false`.

regexp.description: Regex that header value should match.

block.description: Check fails if headers do not match.

insecure_skip_verify.description: Disable target certificate validation. Defaults to `false`.

server_name.description: Used to verify the hostname for the targets.

block.description: TLS config.
Settings for HTTP check. The target must be a URL (http or https).

condition.description: The condition of the assertion: NOT_CONTAINS, EQUALS, STARTS_WITH, ENDS_WITH, TYPE_OF, CONTAINS

expression.description: The expression of the assertion. Should start with $.

subject.description: The subject of the assertion: RESPONSE_HEADERS, HTTP_STATUS_CODE, RESPONSE_BODY

type.description: The type of assertion to make: TEXT, JSON_PATH_VALUE, JSON_PATH_ASSERTION, REGEX_ASSERTION

block.description: Assertions to make on the request response

url.description: The URL for the request

content_encoding.description: The content encoding of the body

content_type.description: The content type of the body

block.description: The body of the HTTP request used in probe.

name.description: Name of the header to send

value.description: Value of the header to send

block.description: The headers to send with the request

name.description: Name of the query field to send

value.description: Value of the query field to send

block.description: Query fields to send with the request
An individual MultiHTTP request

attribute.description: The attribute to use when finding the variable value. Only used when type is CSS_SELECTOR

expression.description: The expression to when finding the variable. Should start with $. Only use when type is JSON_PATH or REGEX

name.description: The name of the variable to extract

type.description: The method of finding the variable value to extract. JSON_PATH, REGEX, CSS_SELECTOR

block.description: Variables to extract from the request response
Settings for MultiHTTP check. The target must be a URL (http or https)

dont_fragment.description: Set the DF-bit in the IP-header. Only works with ipV4. Defaults to `false`.

ip_version.description: Options are `V4`, `V6`, `Any`. Specifies whether the corresponding check will be performed using IPv4 or IPv6. The `Any` value indicates that IPv6 should be used, falling back to IPv4 if that's not available. Defaults to `V4`.

block.description: Settings for ping (ICMP) check. The target must be a valid hostname or IP address.

ip_version.description: Options are `V4`, `V6`, `Any`. Specifies whether the corresponding check will be performed using IPv4 or IPv6. The `Any` value indicates that IPv6 should be used, falling back to IPv4 if that's not available. Defaults to `V4`.

tls.description: Whether or not TLS is used when the connection is initiated. Defaults to `false`.

start_tls.description: Upgrade TCP connection to TLS. Defaults to `false`.

block.description: The query sent in the TCP probe and the expected associated response.

insecure_skip_verify.description: Disable target certificate validation. Defaults to `false`.

server_name.description: Used to verify the hostname for the targets.

block.description: TLS config.
Settings for TCP check. The target must be of the form `<host>:<port>`, where the host portion must be a valid hostname or IP address.

max_hops.description: Maximum TTL for the trace Defaults to `64`.

max_unknown_hops.description: Maximum number of hosts to travers that give no response Defaults to `15`.

ptr_lookup.description: Reverse lookup hostnames from IP addresses Defaults to `true`.

block.description: Settings for traceroute check. The target must be a valid hostname or IP address
Check settings. Should contain exactly one nested block.

Synthetic Monitoring checks are tests that run on selected probes at defined
intervals and report metrics and logs back to your Grafana Cloud account. The
target for checks can be a domain name, a server, or a website, depending on
what information you would like to gather about your endpoint. You can define
multiple checks for a single endpoint to check different capabilities.

* [Official documentation](https://grafana.com/docs/grafana-cloud/monitor-public-endpoints/checks/)

metrics_publisher_key.description: The [Grafana Cloud access policy](https://grafana.com/docs/grafana-cloud/account-management/authentication-and-permissions/access-policies/) with the following scopes: `stacks:read`, `metrics:write`, `logs:write`, `traces:write`. This is used to publish metrics and logs to Grafana Cloud stack.

sm_access_token.description: Generated token to access the SM API.

stack_id.description: The ID or slug of the stack to install SM on.

stack_sm_api_url.description: The URL of the SM API to install SM on. This depends on the stack region, find the list of API URLs here: https://grafana.com/docs/grafana-cloud/monitor-public-endpoints/private-probes/#probe-api-server-url. A static mapping exists in the provider but it may not contain all the regions. If it does contain the stack's region, this field is computed automatically and readable.

block.description:
Sets up Synthetic Monitoring on a Grafana cloud stack and generates a token. 
Once a Grafana Cloud stack is created, a user can either use this resource or go into the UI to install synthetic monitoring.
This resource cannot be imported but it can be used on an existing Synthetic Monitoring installation without issues.

**Note that this resource must be used on a provider configured with Grafana Cloud credentials.**

* [Official documentation](https://grafana.com/docs/grafana-cloud/monitor-public-endpoints/installation/)
* [API documentation](https://github.com/grafana/synthetic-monitoring-api-go-client/blob/main/docs/API.md#apiv1registerinstall)

Required access policy scopes:

* stacks:read

auth_token.description: The probe authentication token. Your probe must use this to authenticate with Grafana Cloud.

labels.description: Custom labels to be included with collected metrics and logs.

name.description: Name of the probe.

public.description: Public probes are run by Grafana Labs and can be used by all users. Only Grafana Labs managed public probes will be set to `true`. Defaults to `false`.

tenant_id.description: The tenant ID of the probe.

block.description:
Besides the public probes run by Grafana Labs, you can also install your
own private probes. These are only accessible to you and only write data to
your Grafana Cloud account. Private probes are instances of the open source
Grafana Synthetic Monitoring Agent.

* [Official documentation](https://grafana.com/docs/grafana-cloud/monitor-public-endpoints/private-probes/)

email.description: An email address for the team.

ignore_externally_synced_members.description:
Ignores team members that have been added to team by [Team Sync](https://grafana.com/docs/grafana/latest/setup-grafana/configure-security/configure-team-sync/).
Team Sync can be provisioned using [grafana_team_external_group resource](https://registry.terraform.io/providers/grafana/grafana/latest/docs/resources/team_external_group).
 Defaults to `true`.

members.description:

home_dashboard_uid.description: The UID of the dashboard to display when a team member logs in. Defaults to ``.

theme.description: The default theme for this team. Available themes are `light`, `dark`, `system`, or an empty string for the default theme. Defaults to ``.

timezone.description: The default timezone for this team. Available values are `utc`, `browser`, or an empty string for the default. Defaults to ``.

week_start.description: The default week start day for this team. Available values are `sunday`, `monday`, `saturday`, or an empty string for the default. Defaults to ``.
